article.bdy:
The BCJR algorithm is an algorithm for maximum a posteriori decoding of error correcting codes defined on trellises (principally convolutional codes). The algorithm is named after its inventers: Bahl, Cocke,
Jelinek
and Raviv 1. This algorithm is critical to modern iteratively-decoded error-correcting codes including turbo codes and low-density parity-check codes.
